The application will be addressed to the Electoral Registration Officer(ERO) of the Assembly Constituency (AC)/Parliamentary Constituency(PC) in which the applicant is ordinarily residing. In case the applicant does not know or has any doubt about number and name of Assembly Constituency /Parliamentary Constituency, assistance may be extended by the Electoral Registration Officer You can find your constituency at- link You can find your polling booth at- link You can find your block level officer at- link ALTERNATIVELY, you can apply online at link
Process:
Submit FORM 6 if you are 18 years or above or you will turn 18 in few months along with the given below documents:

1) Passport sized photo: A recent good quality passport size unsigned colour photograph (4.5cm X 3.5cm) with white background should be pasted in the space provided. 
2)Self attested copy of document supporting age proof attached
3) Self-attested copy of address proof either in the name of applicant or any one of parents/spouse/adult child, if already enrolled as elector at the same address
4) Disability Certificate
5) Elector’s Photo Identity Card (EPIC): EPIC will be delivered at given postal address after enrolment, free of cost through speed post under proper acknowledgement. 

Form 6 can also be collected from Electoral Registration Officers / Assistant Electoral Registration Officers and Booth Level Officers. The application accompanied by copies of the documents mentioned above can be filed in person before the concerned Electoral Registration Officer / Assistant Electoral Registration Officer or sent by post addressed to them or can be handed over to the Booth Level Officer of your polling area.

Process:
Submit FORM 8 along with the given below documents
1) Existing EPIC number
2)  New address proof in case of change in address
3) Proof of documents in case of corrections required in name/ photo of applicant 
4) Copy of FIR/Police report for lost EPIC

Process: Login to the Election Commission of India website - link and search for your name in the electoral poll in any of these 3 ways: Search by personal details Search by EPIC Search by registered mobile number

Resources: Birth registration within 1 year of child's birth
In Delhi, a birth certificate can be obtained if the event of birth is registered within 21 days from the date of birth. The concerned person responsible for registering the birth are as follows: 1) If the birth happens in a house, the head of the household is responsible for registering the birth. 2) If the birth occurs in hospitals, nursing homes or health centre, any officer authorized by a medical officer is responsible for registering a birth. 3) If a birth occurs in jail, the jail in charge is eligible to report such births. 4) If a birth occurs in the moving vehicle, the person in charge of the vehicle is required to report the birth. Note: If a birth is not recorded within one year of birth, the applicant can contact the place of birth for registration of the event and the Registrar Office for recording the birth. One can submit the prescribed application at: • SBS Place (Gole Market and nearby NDMC area, L.H.M.C Hospital & R.M.L Hospital,New Delhi). • Charak Palika Hospital, MotiBagh,New Delhi.(For Current Home & Hospital Data, Motibagh, Sardar Patel, North & South Anveue, Ashoka Hotal, Netaji Nagar etc.). • Palika Maternity Hospital, Lodhi Road,New Delhi.(PMH/nearby home data)Zone-8 SI office • Kidwai Nagar, New Delhi.(AIIMS, Kidwai Nagar, Laxmi Bai Nagar, Ansari Nagar) • Sarojini Nagar Center,(Shanti Aavedna Hospital & Trauma Centre A.I.I.M.S, sarojini Nagar New Delhi). ALTERNATIVELY, submit the online application form at link
Process: 1) Login to the MCD's Birth/Death registration website- link 2) Fill all the details as per the prescribed form online. Ensure you apply to the correct zone of birth. 3)Note-down the system generated Registration Number for subsequent usage. 4) Attach the following documents: - Photo identity card of mother - Photo identity card of father - Vaccination card (optional) 5) UID Can be -Ration Card/ Election Id Card/ Original Certificate from two Credible Person/ Aadhar card/ Passport/ Marriage Certificate/ Service Id Card/ CGHS/ESI Card/ Bank Documents (Passbook, Fd. etc) / Adoption deed/ ANC Card/ Child Vaccination card. 6) Affidavit consisting of place, date and time of the birth of the person and 7) SDM order
Cost involved:
- Nil within 21 days of birth
- Rs. 2/- between 22 days and 1 month
- Rs. 5/- one month to one year
No. of days it takes to complete process: The birth certificate in Delhi will be issued within seven working days from the date of application.

Resources: Birth registration after 1 year of child's birth
One can submit the prescribed application at: i) For event more than 1 yr- International Inoculation Centre (HQ) Birth and Death Centre, Mandir Marg (MCD Office). ALTERNATIVELY, submit the online application form at link
Process: 1) Login to the MCD's Birth/Death registration website- link 2) Fill all the details as per the prescribed form online. Ensure you apply to the correct zone of birth. 3)Note-down the system generated Registration Number for subsequent usage. 4)Attach the following dcuments - Photo identity card of mother (e Ration Card/ PAN Card/ Aadhaar Card/ Passport/ Bank passbook/ Voter ID Card). Can approach CWC if no document. - Photo identity card of father (optional)- explain why father's document not there. - SDM Order Copy (if MCD does not do it or do not want to go to CWC and has documents) - Copy of verification certificate issued by E-district - residence document/self declaration for physical verification such as electricity bill - if child enrolled in anganwadi, vaccination card can be uploaded on MCD website

One can visit and submit the prescribed application at: • SBS Place (Gole Market and nearby NDMC area, L.H.M.C Hospital & R.M.L Hospital,New Delhi). • Charak Palika Hospital, MotiBagh,New Delhi.(For Current Home & Hospital Data, Motibagh, Sardar Patel, North & South Anveue, Ashoka Hotal, Netaji Nagar etc.). • Palika Maternity Hospital, Lodhi Road,New Delhi.(PMH/nearby home data)Zone-8 SI office • Kidwai Nagar, New Delhi.(AIIMS, Kidwai Nagar, Laxmi Bai Nagar, Ansari Nagar) • Sarojini Nagar Center,(Shanti Aavedna Hospital & Trauma Centre A.I.I.M.S, sarojini Nagar New Delhi). ALTERNATIVELY, submit the online application form at link
Process: 1) Login to the MCD's Birth/Death registration website- link 2) Fill the Birth Correction form and attach the following documents: - Hospital correction letter (in case of institutional events) / certified letter from 2 credible person (in case of total name change) / Adoption deed or adoption order issues from court (in case of adoption) - Photo identity card of mother (e Ration Card/ PAN Card/ Aadhaar Card/ Passport/ Bank passbook/ Voter ID Card) - Photo identity card of father (optional) - Educational document of child in case of school going child (if child age is greater than 6 years)

ALTERNATIVELY, submit the online application form at link

Approach the SDM of your area or you can also approach the concerned office of the Deputy Commissioner during 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM on any working day. ALTERNATIVELY, you can apply online. (link)
Process:
Submit application form along with the given below documents
- Identity proof including AADHAR No/PAN / Passport / Driving Licence / Voters Card. 
- The photograph of the applicant will be captured through web camera at the time of submission of application or at the time of verification. 
- The name and photograph of the applicant should match with photo of the applicant on the ID proof- A copy of SC/ST certificate of father, brother, sister or of his/her blood relative from paternal side.
- Self declaration in case of SC/ST certificate issued from outside Delhi in prescribed Performa rate (Self declaration from the major if the children are below the 18 years.)
- No Affidavit is required to be furnished by the applicants who append copy of SC Certificate of their father side issued from Delhi State.
- Where no SC/ST certificate has been issued to any member of applicant's family, in that case, two government servants should certify that the Applicant is permanently known to them and he belongs to the caste (name the cast) which is SC/ST, alongwith the attested copies of their identity cards.
- In case of married women, the local enquiry is conducted at the place of resedence prior to marriage as well as the place of residence after marriage.
- Supporting document for the present residential proof like Voters Card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill etc.
- Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate, School certificate or passport)

IMPORTANT: All documents can be self attested. A . local enquiry is conducted in all cases to verify applicant's residence/caste. No fee is required to be paid.
No. of days it takes to complete process: Delhi SC State Certificates are generally issued in 14 days if full documentation is available.

Process:
Documents for other State SC/ST Certificate
- Application form duly self attested. (chrome-extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https://revenue.delhi.gov.in/sites/default/files/revenue/cc/scapplicationform_1.pdf) 
- Birth Certificate or School Certificate 
- Copy of Ration Card or Other Proof of Residence.
- Copy of SC/ST certificate of father issued by SDO/Tehsildar of the State. Original to be produced for examination

IMPORTANT : All documents needs to be self attested. A local enquiry is conducted in all cases to verify applicant's residence/caste

Approach the SDM of your area or you can also approach the concerned office of the Deputy Commissioner during 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM on any working day. ALTERNATIVELY, you can apply online. (link)
Process:
Submit application form along with the given below documents
- Identity proof including AADHAR No/PAN / Passport / Driving Licence / Voters Card. 
- The photograph of the applicant will be captured through web camera at the time of submission of application or at the time of verification. 
- The name and photograph of the applicant should match with photo of the applicant on the ID proof
- Self declaration in prescribed Performa(Self declaration from  the major if the children are bolow the 18 years).
- Supporting document for the present residential proof like Voter Card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill etc.
- A copy of OBC certificate of father, brother, sister or of his/her blood relative from paternal side, if available.
- Two attestation by MP/MLA/Councillor/Gazetted Officers, declaring the caste of applicant and continuous stay in Delhi since 1993.
- Supporting document of residential proof in Delhi since 1993
- Family income proof(ITR/Salary Slip/Form-16 etc.)

IMPORTANT: All documents needs to be attested by MP/MLA/Gazetted Officer. No fee required.

Locate your nearest Circles Offices and their Food and Supplies Officers: link
Process: Apply online at e-District portal link and register as per given instructions, upload the required documents and submit the same. You can also apply with the help of Mobile Sahayak or can visit your nearest circle office along with filled form and requisite documents. Documents required: 1.Aadhaar Card of all family members. 2. Passport size photo of Head of Family (HoF). 3. Electricity bill (Latest). 4. Residence proof of address if other than Aadhaar address of Head of Family

Approach the SDM of your area or the concerned office of the Deputy Commissioner during 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM on any working day. ALTERNATIVELY, you can apply online. (link)
Process:
Attach the given below documents along with your application form:  
1) Identity proof including AADHAR No./ PAN/Passport/Driving Licence/Voters Card. The name and photograph of the applicant on the AADHAR card should match with Name of the Applicant 
2) Self declaration in prescribed Performa(Self declaration from the major if the children are below the 18 years).    
3) The photograph of the applicant will be captured through web camera at the time of submission of application or at the time of verification. 
4) Supporting document for the present residential proof like Voter Card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill etc.
5) Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate, School certificate or passport).    
6) Proof of continuous stay in Delhi for the last 5 years, such as Passbook, Education certificate, Electricity bill, House tax, water bill etc.
7) Contact No. and copy of I Card of the class I gazetted officer who has attested the form.

IMPORTANT : All documents needs to be attested by Gazetted Officer at the time of submitting. No fee is required to be paid.
No. of days it takes to complete process: Certificates are generally issued in 14 days.

Process: Visit THE RIGHT GUIDE- link for all information on Rights & Entitlement, Resources & Support for Person(s) with disability in Delhi.

Approach the SDM of your area or the concerned office of the Deputy Commissioner during 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM on any working day. ALTERNATIVELY, you can apply online. (link)
Process:
Attach the given below along with your application form:  
1) Identity proof including AADHAR No./Passport/Driving Licence/Voters Card. The name of the applicant on the AADHAR card should match with Name of the Applicant.
2) Self declaration in prescribed Performa.
3) The photograph of the applicant will be captured through web camera at the time of submission of application or at the time of verification. the Photograph of the applicant should match with photo of the applicant on the AADHAR.
4) Supporting document for the present residential proof like Voter Card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill etc.
5) Bank statement for last 6 months
6) Salary slip or other documents showing the family income of the applicant. (optional instead of bank statement)
7) PAN is manadatory
8) Residence status of 5 years in Delhi

After submission of form, a nodal officer visits your house to verfiy your house condiition, income status. Alternatively, the SDM might ask you to visit their office with your original documents for proof of income and address.

IMPORTANT : All documents needs to be attested by Gazetted Officer. at the time of submitting No fee is required to be paid.
No. of days it takes to complete process:
Certificates are generally issued in 15-30 days.

Only valid for 6 months. Renewal based on previous documents.

Approach your school's Head of School/Principal with a a letter/application seeking the SLC.
Process:
Ensure that your application letter contains your full name, contact number, class and section. Upon receipt of the application letter, your school will provide you with a form which has to be submitted to the school. 
Fill the form and attach the given below necessary documents.

- Passport size photograph of student
- A copy of the previous mark sheet or report card, if available
- A copy of the birth certificate or any other identity proof.
- Any other document or certificate as requested by the school or education board.

Unique Identification Authority of India- Regional Office, Delhi Ground Floor, Supreme Court Metro Station, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi-110001 Locate the Aadhaar enrollment centre nearest to you- link
Process: The Aadhaar enrolment process includes booking appointment online, visiting Enrolment Centre, filling the enrolment form, getting demographic and biometric data captured, submitting proof of Identity and address documents, before collecting acknowledgement slip containing Enrolment ID. 1) For appointment, visit link and enter your State/ Pincode/ Locality/ District to locate the Aadhaar enrollment centre nearest to you. 2) Visit the centre and make sure to bring the original copies of documents that are proof of the following with you: - Proof of Identity - Proof of Address - Proof of Birth Date 3) Submit the fully completed enrolment form and supporting documents mentioned above. Your photo and biometric information (iris and fingerprint scans) will be taken. 4) The centre representative will issue you with an acknowledgement slip as confirmation of your enrolment. It includes a 14-digit enrolment number. This number can be used to track your Aadhar card application’s status on the following website - link. 5) Once your information has been verified, your Aadhaar card will be posted to you by mail.
Cost involved: Enrolment is free of cost. Information on updation of Aadhaar is available at link

Process: 10th/12th/Migration Certificate - These certificates are provided by the schools after passing the 10th/12th exams. - You can obtain the duplicate of 10th/12th/migration certificate by clicking on Digital Documents at link - Certificates issued after 2017 can also be obtained on DigiLocker link Transfer Certificate (TC) provided for transfer of student from one school to another. - The form is provided by and submitted to the school - DDE verifies the details in the form and the school gets the form stamped by the DDE - the process takes approximately 1 week
Cost involved: Information on fee is available at link
No. of days it takes to complete process:
Duplicates are available instantaneously.

1 week approximately for TC

Process: You can apply for the driver's licence at link
Cost involved: Information on fee is available at link

1) You can also apply ONLINE at link and upload the necessary documents. 2) Payment of fees can be made online or offline. 3) Apply for an appointment to the office of the concerned SDM/ADM.
Process:
Documents:

- Application form completed in all respect and signed by both Husband & Wife.
- Fee as applicable is to be deposited with Marriage Clerk and the receipt is to be appended with the form.
- Adhaar No. is not compulsory, if Adhaar No. is not available, Provide any one identity proof of Voter ID Card/Driving License/Passport/Pan Card
- Self attested documentary evidence of date of birth of both parties. (Matriculation Certificate/Passport/Birth Certificate)
- Self attested residential Proof of both the parties (Voter I-Card/Ration Card/Driving Licence/Passport etc.).
- Self attested Marriage Invitation card, if available.
- Separate affidavits in prescribed format from Husband & Wife giving:-
         - Date and place of marriage.
         - Date of Birth.
         - Martial status at the time of marriage.
         - Affirmation that the parties are not related to each other within the prohibited degree of relationship as per Hindu Marriage Act.
         - Citizenship.
- For the purpose of identification, the proof may be in the form of a certificate containing the attested photographs of the Husband & Wife duly attested by any officer/official of central or state governments or Union Territory Administration of PSU/autonomous bodies whose identity can be established or by any person having PAN of Income Tax.
- Passport size photograph of both the parties (2 Copies each) as well as their Ceremonial photographs duly attested by any officer official of central or state governments or Union Territory Administration of PSU/autonomous bodies whose identity can be established or by any person having PAN of Income Tax.
- Attested copy of divorce decree/order in case of a divorce and death certificate of spouse in case of widow/widower.
- Where marriage has been solemnized at a religious place, a certificate from the priest is required.
- In case of a foreign national, a certificate from the Embassy concerned regarding his or her present martial status.
- In case one of the parties belong to other than Hindu, Budhist, Jain and Sikh religions, a conversion certificate from the priest who solemnized the marriage is required.
- The applicants have to apply for registration of marriage to the office of the Deputy Commissioner in whose territorial jurisdiction either of the applicants resides.
- If the marriage is solemnized in Delhi but the applicants were not residing in Delhi, application for registration of the marriage shall have to be made to office of the Deputy Commissioner in whose jurisdiction the marriage has been solemnized.
Cost involved: Payment online and offline option is available (Solemnization fees- 500, Registration fees-500 (if getting registered within 60 days or else 500 rs. penalty extra, or if the days exceed 120 then penalty is 1000rs.)
